name: Alcatraz Harry
description: Alcatraz Harry is a maze game. The player takes on the role of a prisoner named Harry, who must escape from the prison camp. In order to do so he must steal escape equipment and secret files. The prison maze is a grid containing a scattered selection of revolvers, ladders, wire cutters and similar objects. There are also guards to complicate the route. The player must search for items and avoid the patrolling guards. The game has 144 different locations

shot.caption: Title screen
Instruction - map
Instruction - Harry & equipment
Instruction - enemies
Game begins
Guards
Dog
Wrong grid
Execution - game over
Instructions are the main pillar of this game. Without them the game might impetuously and unfairly be thrown at the trash bin.
The evidence, the final proof borders were used with specific purposes! Although the instructions are wrong. Red is equivalent to 3 adjacent mines, Magenda two.
The Car. A very important tool in this game. If you find a car, it immediately takes you to the starting room, which is where you are going to store the necessary tools to escape.
Another important one: The grid. If you forget to note the correct localization of the correct grid, pointed at the begging of the game, Pardais ao Ninho: The game is Kaput.

Thank you... May the forc... 
- ...but this is not advertising! I was injected with a  (beep) (beep) serum when I was 4. It's stronger than me! (DON'T FORGET DECEMBER THIS YEAR!! LUK.. Mnnnnfff)
Starting the game.
This is the clue I mentioned before. Without this number you most probably wont find the correct coordinate for the specific grid which leads to the secret files room.
Gimme some music bro! "Sunday Night Fever" on da jukebox!
How many of you kids recognize that film?... (Ha-a-ah! Stayin' allliveee!!)
Can't stop dancing, Gee Bees forever!

Now All togetther!!
- YYY MM CC Aye!
This looks like someone couldn't contain himself anymore, but in fact it's one of the exits of a tunnel.
See? This game has much more than it seems.
Hello granny! I'm just collecting this ladder to repaint the wall of the latrine, everything's alright, kay... no worries, cool, peace.... may the forc...
The car mentioned before. It's yellow and it resembles the one of Mr. Kesuke. Mr. Pat Morita forever.
A strategic shortcut to the storing room. In fact, it's another homage to Mr. Pat Morita
You just reached the secret files room. Still dancing man.
A grenade, weaponry for my mates to escape.
Another important tool, so that we and my men can play jumping the rope.
Status report. You need 30 pieces of equipment so that you can pass to next stage.
30 pieces gathered after stealing the car. Generating the minefield. Few people know about this.
The minefield is often generated with impossibilities. Dead alleys where you can do nothing... unless I haven't read the instructions in more detail.
The red border indicates the weather is going to become turbulent (...3 adjacent mines, stop being a joker by the way...)
Curiously, yellow border means safe spot without adjacent mines. But that's not at all what's happening here, I just crossed into a mine which blew myself into tinny pieces.
See...! The pieces are now spreading all over the place like a gamma ray storm.
I wasn't lying.
Finally, THE hole in the barbed wire!
Stayin alive! Yeah!
Hall of Fame. Can't believe I hated so much this game when I was 9.
